newsitem.title: JAPAN: TEPCO reactor start-up date unclear.
newsitem.headline: TEPCO reactor start-up date unclear.

text.p: Tokyo Electric Power Co Inc (TEPCO) said on Friday it had not yet decided when to restart a 1.36 million kilowatt (kw) reactor in northern Japan, which was shut on Wednesday due to unusual sounds coming from near a turbine.
The seventh reactor at the Kashiwazaki Kariwa nuclear power plant on the Sea of Japan coast had been going through various checks ahead of commercial operation due to start in July.
"An investigation into the cause of the sounds is still going on, and we cannot set the (restart) date until the cause is identified," a TEPCO spokesman said.

The start of the reactor's commercial operations would make the Kashiwazaki Kariwa complex the world's largest nuclear power plant with a total power generation capacity of 8.2 million kw, surpassing the Bruce plant in Ontario, Canada, which has a capacity of 7.3 million, he said.
